title: (x) Looking for ornate/vintage fonts with swashes - various {gang}
content:
I absolutely love Veer's Bookman Swash and I'm wondering if anyone knows any similarly ornate/vintage fonts out there.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521080257im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bookman_example_6471.jpg)
author: kiarostami

comments.content:
[Cabernet](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521080257/http:/www.jawarts.com/Fonts.htm)

And I recently got in contact to the digitized [Cooper Black Swash Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521080257/http:/www.wordshape.com/)

[Goudy Two Shoes](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521080257/http:/www.canadatype.com/showfont.php?id=91)

And you may want to look at these threads:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/19756](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521080257/http:/typophile.com/node/19756 "http://typophile.com/node/19756")  
 [http://typophile.com/node/13769](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521080257/http:/typophile.com/node/13769 "http://typophile.com/node/13769")  
 [http://typophile.com/node/2782](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521080257/http:/typophile.com/node/2782 "http://typophile.com/node/2782")

Many of these go a little overboard on the frills. For a judicious use of swashes, see Matthew Carter's [Galliard](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521080257/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=CA.6675.0.0).

[
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521080257im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FOM-Galliard_02_5797.gif)
](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521080257/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=CA.6675.0.0)

Of course, if you want to be obvious about the excessive flourishing, see [Incognito](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521080257/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FT.123355.0.0) and [Zanzibar](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521080257/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FT.118699.0.0) by Gábor Kóthay.
